title: Reasons for eating fast food in the U.S. as of August 2014
summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Response, and Share of respondents in each Response on the y axis.
The Share of respondents is appeared to be the highest at Response Convenient and lowest at Response Other.
The highest Response Convenient has 61.6 more Share of respondents than the lowest Response Other.
min_summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Response, and Share of respondents in each Response on the y axis.
Response Convenient has the highest Share of respondents and Other has the lowest Share of respondents.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Response, and Share of respondents in each Response on the y axis.
The Share of respondents is appeared to be the highest at Response Convenient and lowest at Response Other.
The highest Response Convenient has 61.6 more Share of respondents than the lowest Response Other.
max_summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Response, and Share of respondents in each Response on the y axis.
The Share of respondents is highest at Response Convenient and lowest at Response Other.
The difference of Share of respondents between the highest and lowest Response is 61.6.
Response Convenient is higher than any other Responses with value 67.2, followed by Cheap, and I just like it. Down to Response Other with the lowest value 5.6.
The highest value 67.2 at Convenient is almost 2.27 times larger than the average value 29.66.
The Share of respondents is 148.3 if we add up values of all Responses.
